00068 /*********** mount lookup *********/
00069 
00070 static DEFINE_MUTEX(lustre_mount_info_lock);
00071 static struct list_head server_mount_info_list =
00072         LIST_HEAD_INIT(server_mount_info_list);
00073 
00074 static struct lustre_mount_info *server_find_mount(const char *name)
00075 {
00076         struct list_head *tmp;
00077         struct lustre_mount_info *lmi;
00078         ENTRY;
00079 
00080         list_for_each(tmp, &server_mount_info_list) {
00081                 lmi = list_entry(tmp, struct lustre_mount_info,
00082                                  lmi_list_chain);
00083                 if (strcmp(name, lmi->lmi_name) == 0)
00084                         RETURN(lmi);
00085         }
00086         RETURN(NULL);
00087 }
00088 
00089 /* we must register an obd for a mount before we call the setup routine.
00090  *_setup will call lustre_get_mount to get the mnt struct
00091  by obd_name, since we can't pass the pointer to setup. */
00092 static int server_register_mount(const char *name, struct super_block *sb)
00093 {
00094         struct lustre_mount_info *lmi;
00095         char *name_cp;
00096         ENTRY;
00097 
00098         LASSERT(sb);
00099 
00100         OBD_ALLOC(lmi, sizeof(*lmi));
00101         if (!lmi)
00102                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00103         OBD_ALLOC(name_cp, strlen(name) + 1);
00104         if (!name_cp) {
00105                 OBD_FREE(lmi, sizeof(*lmi));
00106                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00107         }
00108         strcpy(name_cp, name);
00109 
00110         mutex_lock(&lustre_mount_info_lock);
00111 
00112         if (server_find_mount(name)) {
00113                 mutex_unlock(&lustre_mount_info_lock);
00114                 OBD_FREE(lmi, sizeof(*lmi));
00115                 OBD_FREE(name_cp, strlen(name) + 1);
00116                 CERROR("Already registered %s\n", name);
00117                 RETURN(-EEXIST);
00118         }
00119         lmi->lmi_name = name_cp;
00120         lmi->lmi_sb = sb;
00121         list_add(&lmi->lmi_list_chain, &server_mount_info_list);
00122 
00123         mutex_unlock(&lustre_mount_info_lock);
00124 
00125         CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "register mount %p from %s\n", sb, name);
00126 
00127         RETURN(0);
00128 }
00129 
00130 /* when an obd no longer needs a mount */
00131 static int server_deregister_mount(const char *name)
00132 {
00133         struct lustre_mount_info *lmi;
00134         ENTRY;
00135 
00136         mutex_lock(&lustre_mount_info_lock);
00137         lmi = server_find_mount(name);
00138         if (!lmi) {
00139                 mutex_unlock(&lustre_mount_info_lock);
00140                 CERROR("%s not registered\n", name);
00141                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00142         }
00143 
00144         CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "deregister mount %p from %s\n", lmi->lmi_sb, name);
00145 
00146         OBD_FREE(lmi->lmi_name, strlen(lmi->lmi_name) + 1);
00147         list_del(&lmi->lmi_list_chain);
00148         OBD_FREE(lmi, sizeof(*lmi));
00149         mutex_unlock(&lustre_mount_info_lock);
00150 
00151         RETURN(0);
00152 }
00153 
00154 /* obd's look up a registered mount using their obdname. This is just
00155    for initial obd setup to find the mount struct.  It should not be
00156    called every time you want to mntget. */
00157 struct lustre_mount_info *server_get_mount(const char *name)
00158 {
00159         struct lustre_mount_info *lmi;
00160         struct lustre_sb_info *lsi;
00161         ENTRY;
00162 
00163         mutex_lock(&lustre_mount_info_lock);
00164         lmi = server_find_mount(name);
00165         mutex_unlock(&lustre_mount_info_lock);
00166         if (!lmi) {
00167                 CERROR("Can't find mount for %s\n", name);
00168                 RETURN(NULL);
00169         }
00170         lsi = s2lsi(lmi->lmi_sb);
00171 
00172         atomic_inc(&lsi->lsi_mounts);
00173 
00174         CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "get mount %p from %s, refs=%d\n", lmi->lmi_sb,
00175                name, atomic_read(&lsi->lsi_mounts));
00176 
00177         RETURN(lmi);
00178 }
00179 EXPORT_SYMBOL(server_get_mount);
00180 
00193 int server_put_mount(const char *name, bool dereg_mnt)
00194 {
00195         struct lustre_mount_info *lmi;
00196         struct lustre_sb_info *lsi;
00197         ENTRY;
00198 
00199         mutex_lock(&lustre_mount_info_lock);
00200         lmi = server_find_mount(name);
00201         mutex_unlock(&lustre_mount_info_lock);
00202         if (!lmi) {
00203                 CERROR("Can't find mount for %s\n", name);
00204                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00205         }
00206         lsi = s2lsi(lmi->lmi_sb);
00207 
00208         CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "put mount %p from %s, refs=%d\n",
00209                lmi->lmi_sb, name, atomic_read(&lsi->lsi_mounts));
00210 
00211         if (lustre_put_lsi(lmi->lmi_sb))
00212                 CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "Last put of mount %p from %s\n",
00213                        lmi->lmi_sb, name);
00214 
00215         if (dereg_mnt)
00216                 /* this obd should never need the mount again */
00217                 server_deregister_mount(name);
00218 
00219         RETURN(0);
00220 }
00221 EXPORT_SYMBOL(server_put_mount);
00222 
00223 /* Set up a MGS to serve startup logs */
00224 static int server_start_mgs(struct super_block *sb)
00225 {
00226         struct lustre_sb_info    *lsi = s2lsi(sb);
00227         struct lustre_mount_info *lmi;
00228         int    rc = 0;
00229         ENTRY;
00230 
00231         /* It is impossible to have more than 1 MGS per node, since
00232            MGC wouldn't know which to connect to */
00233         lmi = server_find_mount(LUSTRE_MGS_OBDNAME);
00234         if (lmi) {
00235                 lsi = s2lsi(lmi->lmi_sb);
00236                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x15d, "The MGS service was already started"
00237                                    " from server\n");
00238                 RETURN(-EALREADY);
00239         }
00240 
00241         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "Start MGS service %s\n", LUSTRE_MGS_OBDNAME);
00242 
00243         rc = server_register_mount(LUSTRE_MGS_OBDNAME, sb);
00244 
00245         if (!rc) {
00246                 rc = lustre_start_simple(LUSTRE_MGS_OBDNAME, LUSTRE_MGS_NAME,
00247                                          LUSTRE_MGS_OBDNAME, NULL, NULL,
00248                                          lsi->lsi_osd_obdname, NULL);
00249                 /* server_deregister_mount() is not called previously, for lsi
00250                  * and other stuff can't be freed cleanly when mgs calls
00251                  * server_put_mount() in error handling case (see b=17758),
00252                  * this problem is caused by a bug in mgs_init0, which forgot
00253                  * calling server_put_mount in error case. */
00254 
00255                 if (rc)
00256                         server_deregister_mount(LUSTRE_MGS_OBDNAME);
00257         }
00258 
00259         if (rc)
00260                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x15e, "Failed to start MGS '%s' (%d). "
00261                                    "Is the 'mgs' module loaded?\n",
00262                                    LUSTRE_MGS_OBDNAME, rc);
00263         RETURN(rc);
00264 }
00265 
00266 static int server_stop_mgs(struct super_block *sb)
00267 {
00268         struct obd_device *obd;
00269         int rc;
00270         struct lustre_mount_info *lmi;
00271         ENTRY;
00272 
00273         /* Do not stop MGS if this device is not the running MGT */
00274         lmi = server_find_mount(LUSTRE_MGS_OBDNAME);
00275         if (lmi != NULL && lmi->lmi_sb != sb)
00276                 RETURN(0);
00277 
00278         CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "Stop MGS service %s\n", LUSTRE_MGS_OBDNAME);
00279 
00280         /* There better be only one MGS */
00281         obd = class_name2obd(LUSTRE_MGS_OBDNAME);
00282         if (!obd) {
00283                 CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "mgs %s not running\n", LUSTRE_MGS_OBDNAME);
00284                 RETURN(-EALREADY);
00285         }
00286 
00287         /* The MGS should always stop when we say so */
00288         obd->obd_force = 1;
00289         rc = class_manual_cleanup(obd);
00290         RETURN(rc);
00291 }
00292 
00293 /* Since there's only one mgc per node, we have to change it's fs to get
00294    access to the right disk. */
00295 static int server_mgc_set_fs(const struct lu_env *env,
00296                              struct obd_device *mgc, struct super_block *sb)
00297 {
00298         struct lustre_sb_info *lsi = s2lsi(sb);
00299         int rc;
00300         ENTRY;
00301 
00302         CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "Set mgc disk for %s\n", lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_dev);
00303 
00304         /* cl_mgc_sem in mgc insures we sleep if the mgc_fs is busy */
00305         rc = obd_set_info_async(env, mgc->obd_self_export,
00306                                 sizeof(KEY_SET_FS), KEY_SET_FS,
00307                                 sizeof(*sb), sb, NULL);
00308         if (rc != 0)
00309                 CERROR("can't set_fs %d\n", rc);
00310 
00311         RETURN(rc);
00312 }
00313 
00314 static int server_mgc_clear_fs(const struct lu_env *env,
00315                                struct obd_device *mgc)
00316 {
00317         int rc;
00318         ENTRY;
00319 
00320         CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "Unassign mgc disk\n");
00321 
00322         rc = obd_set_info_async(env, mgc->obd_self_export,
00323                                 sizeof(KEY_CLEAR_FS), KEY_CLEAR_FS,
00324                                 0, NULL, NULL);
00325         RETURN(rc);
00326 }

00328 static inline bool is_mdc_device(const char *devname)
00329 {
00330         char *ptr;
00331 
00332         ptr = strrchr(devname, '-');
00333         return ptr != NULL && strcmp(ptr, "-mdc") == 0;
00334 }
00335 
00336 static inline bool tgt_is_mdt(const char *tgtname, __u32 *idx)
00337 {
00338         int type;
00339 
00340         type = server_name2index(tgtname, idx, NULL);
00341 
00342         return type == LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MDT;
00343 }
00344 
00349 int tgt_name2lwp_name(const char *tgt_name, char *lwp_name, int len, __u32 idx)
00350 {
00351         char            *fsname;
00352         const char      *tgt;
00353         int             rc;
00354         ENTRY;
00355 
00356         OBD_ALLOC(fsname, MTI_NAME_MAXLEN);
00357         if (fsname == NULL)
00358                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00359 
00360         rc = server_name2fsname(tgt_name, fsname, &tgt);
00361         if (rc != 0) {
00362                 CERROR("%s: failed to get fsname from tgt_name: rc = %d\n",
00363                        tgt_name, rc);
00364                 GOTO(cleanup, rc);
00365         }
00366 
00367         if (*tgt != '-' && *tgt != ':') {
00368                 CERROR("%s: invalid tgt_name name!\n", tgt_name);
00369                 GOTO(cleanup, rc = -EINVAL);
00370         }
00371 
00372         tgt++;
00373         if (strncmp(tgt, "OST", 3) != 0 && strncmp(tgt, "MDT", 3) != 0) {
00374                 CERROR("%s is not an OST or MDT target!\n", tgt_name);
00375                 GOTO(cleanup, rc = -EINVAL);
00376         }
00377         snprintf(lwp_name, len, "%s-MDT%04x-%s-%s",
00378                  fsname, idx, LUSTRE_LWP_NAME, tgt);
00379 
00380         GOTO(cleanup, rc = 0);
00381 
00382 cleanup:
00383         if (fsname != NULL)
00384                 OBD_FREE(fsname, MTI_NAME_MAXLEN);
00385 
00386         return rc;
00387 }
00388 EXPORT_SYMBOL(tgt_name2lwp_name);
00389 
00390 static struct list_head lwp_register_list =
00391         LIST_HEAD_INIT(lwp_register_list);
00392 static DEFINE_SPINLOCK(lwp_register_list_lock);
00393 
00394 static void lustre_put_lwp_item(struct lwp_register_item *lri)
00395 {
00396         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&lri->lri_ref)) {
00397                 LASSERT(list_empty(&lri->lri_list));
00398 
00399                 if (*lri->lri_exp != NULL)
00400                         class_export_put(*lri->lri_exp);
00401                 OBD_FREE_PTR(lri);
00402         }
00403 }
00404 
00405 int lustre_register_lwp_item(const char *lwpname, struct obd_export **exp,
00406                              register_lwp_cb cb_func, void *cb_data)
00407 {
00408         struct obd_device        *lwp;
00409         struct lwp_register_item *lri;
00410         ENTRY;
00411 
00412         LASSERTF(strlen(lwpname) < MTI_NAME_MAXLEN, "lwpname is too long %s\n",
00413                  lwpname);
00414         LASSERT(exp != NULL && *exp == NULL);
00415 
00416         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(lri);
00417         if (lri == NULL)
00418                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00419 
00420         lwp = class_name2obd(lwpname);
00421         if (lwp != NULL && lwp->obd_set_up == 1) {
00422                 struct obd_uuid *uuid;
00423 
00424                 OBD_ALLOC_PTR(uuid);
00425                 if (uuid == NULL) {
00426                         OBD_FREE_PTR(lri);
00427                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00428                 }
00429                 memcpy(uuid->uuid, lwpname, strlen(lwpname));
00430                 *exp = cfs_hash_lookup(lwp->obd_uuid_hash, uuid);
00431                 OBD_FREE_PTR(uuid);
00432         }
00433 
00434         memcpy(lri->lri_name, lwpname, strlen(lwpname));
00435         lri->lri_exp = exp;
00436         lri->lri_cb_func = cb_func;
00437         lri->lri_cb_data = cb_data;
00438         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&lri->lri_list);
00439         /*
00440          * Initialize the lri_ref at 2, one will be released before
00441          * current function returned via lustre_put_lwp_item(), the
00442          * other will be released in lustre_deregister_lwp_item().
00443          */
00444         atomic_set(&lri->lri_ref, 2);
00445 
00446         spin_lock(&lwp_register_list_lock);
00447         list_add(&lri->lri_list, &lwp_register_list);
00448         spin_unlock(&lwp_register_list_lock);
00449 
00450         if (*exp != NULL && cb_func != NULL)
00451                 cb_func(cb_data);
00452         lustre_put_lwp_item(lri);
00453 
00454         RETURN(0);
00455 }
00456 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_register_lwp_item);
00457 
00458 void lustre_deregister_lwp_item(struct obd_export **exp)
00459 {
00460         struct lwp_register_item *lri;
00461 
00462         spin_lock(&lwp_register_list_lock);
00463         list_for_each_entry(lri, &lwp_register_list, lri_list) {
00464                 if (exp == lri->lri_exp) {
00465                         list_del_init(&lri->lri_list);
00466                         spin_unlock(&lwp_register_list_lock);
00467 
00468                         lustre_put_lwp_item(lri);
00469                         return;
00470                 }
00471         }
00472         spin_unlock(&lwp_register_list_lock);
00473 }
00474 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_deregister_lwp_item);
00475 
00476 struct obd_export *lustre_find_lwp_by_index(const char *dev, __u32 idx)
00477 {
00478         struct lustre_mount_info *lmi;
00479         struct lustre_sb_info    *lsi;
00480         struct obd_device        *lwp;
00481         struct obd_export        *exp = NULL;
00482         char                      fsname[16];
00483         char                      lwp_name[24];
00484         int                       rc;
00485 
00486         lmi = server_get_mount(dev);
00487         if (lmi == NULL)
00488                 return NULL;
00489 
00490         lsi = s2lsi(lmi->lmi_sb);
00491         rc = server_name2fsname(lsi->lsi_svname, fsname, NULL);
00492         if (rc != 0) {
00493                 CERROR("%s: failed to get fsname: rc = %d\n",
00494                        lsi->lsi_svname, rc);
00495                 goto err_lmi;
00496         }
00497 
00498         snprintf(lwp_name, sizeof(lwp_name), "%s-MDT%04x", fsname, idx);
00499         spin_lock(&lsi->lsi_lwp_lock);
00500         list_for_each_entry(lwp, &lsi->lsi_lwp_list, obd_lwp_list) {
00501                 char *ptr = strstr(lwp->obd_name, lwp_name);
00502 
00503                 if (ptr != NULL && lwp->obd_lwp_export != NULL) {
00504                         exp = class_export_get(lwp->obd_lwp_export);
00505                         break;
00506                 }
00507         }
00508         spin_unlock(&lsi->lsi_lwp_lock);
00509 
00510 err_lmi:
00511         server_put_mount(dev, false);
00512 
00513         return exp;
00514 }
00515 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_find_lwp_by_index);
00516 
00517 void lustre_notify_lwp_list(struct obd_export *exp)
00518 {
00519         struct lwp_register_item *lri;
00520         LASSERT(exp != NULL);
00521 
00522 again:
00523         spin_lock(&lwp_register_list_lock);
00524         list_for_each_entry(lri, &lwp_register_list, lri_list) {
00525                 if (strcmp(exp->exp_obd->obd_name, lri->lri_name))
00526                         continue;
00527                 if (*lri->lri_exp != NULL)
00528                         continue;
00529                 *lri->lri_exp = class_export_get(exp);
00530                 atomic_inc(&lri->lri_ref);
00531                 spin_unlock(&lwp_register_list_lock);
00532 
00533                 if (lri->lri_cb_func != NULL)
00534                         lri->lri_cb_func(lri->lri_cb_data);
00535                 lustre_put_lwp_item(lri);
00536 
00537                 /* Others may have changed the list after we unlock, we have
00538                  * to rescan the list from the beginning. Usually, the list
00539                  * 'lwp_register_list' is very short, and there is 'guard'
00540                  * lri::lri_exp that will prevent the callback to be done
00541                  * repeatedly. So rescanning the list has no problem. */
00542                 goto again;
00543         }
00544         spin_unlock(&lwp_register_list_lock);
00545 }
00546 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_notify_lwp_list);
00547 
00548 static int lustre_lwp_connect(struct obd_device *lwp)
00549 {
00550         struct lu_env            env;
00551         struct lu_context        session_ctx;
00552         struct obd_export       *exp;
00553         struct obd_uuid         *uuid = NULL;
00554         struct obd_connect_data *data = NULL;
00555         int                      rc;
00556         ENTRY;
00557 
00558         /* log has been fully processed, let clients connect */
00559         rc = lu_env_init(&env, lwp->obd_lu_dev->ld_type->ldt_ctx_tags);
00560         if (rc != 0)
00561                 RETURN(rc);
00562 
00563         lu_context_init(&session_ctx, LCT_SERVER_SESSION);
00564         session_ctx.lc_thread = NULL;
00565         lu_context_enter(&session_ctx);
00566         env.le_ses = &session_ctx;
00567 
00568         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(data);
00569         if (data == NULL)
00570                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00571 
00572         data->ocd_connect_flags = OBD_CONNECT_VERSION | OBD_CONNECT_INDEX;
00573         data->ocd_version = LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE;
00574         data->ocd_connect_flags |= OBD_CONNECT_MDS_MDS | OBD_CONNECT_FID |
00575                 OBD_CONNECT_AT | OBD_CONNECT_LRU_RESIZE |
00576                 OBD_CONNECT_FULL20 | OBD_CONNECT_LVB_TYPE |
00577                 OBD_CONNECT_LIGHTWEIGHT | OBD_CONNECT_LFSCK |
00578                 OBD_CONNECT_BULK_MBITS;
00579         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(uuid);
00580         if (uuid == NULL)
00581                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00582 
00583         if (strlen(lwp->obd_name) > sizeof(uuid->uuid)) {
00584                 CERROR("%s: Too long lwp name %s, max_size is %d\n",
00585                        lwp->obd_name, lwp->obd_name, (int)sizeof(uuid->uuid));
00586                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00587         }
00588 
00589         /* Use lwp name as the uuid, so we find the export by lwp name later */
00590         memcpy(uuid->uuid, lwp->obd_name, strlen(lwp->obd_name));
00591         rc = obd_connect(&env, &exp, lwp, uuid, data, NULL);
00592         if (rc != 0) {
00593                 CERROR("%s: connect failed: rc = %d\n", lwp->obd_name, rc);
00594         } else {
00595                 if (unlikely(lwp->obd_lwp_export != NULL))
00596                         class_export_put(lwp->obd_lwp_export);
00597                 lwp->obd_lwp_export = class_export_get(exp);
00598         }
00599 
00600         GOTO(out, rc);
00601 
00602 out:
00603         if (data != NULL)
00604                 OBD_FREE_PTR(data);
00605         if (uuid != NULL)
00606                 OBD_FREE_PTR(uuid);
00607 
00608         lu_env_fini(&env);
00609         lu_context_exit(&session_ctx);
00610         lu_context_fini(&session_ctx);
00611 
00612         return rc;
00613 }
00614 
00619 static int lustre_lwp_setup(struct lustre_cfg *lcfg, struct lustre_sb_info *lsi,
00620                             __u32 idx)
00621 {
00622         struct obd_device       *obd;
00623         char                    *lwpname = NULL;
00624         char                    *lwpuuid = NULL;
00625         int                      rc;
00626         ENTRY;
00627 
00628         rc = class_add_uuid(lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1),
00629                             lcfg->lcfg_nid);
00630         if (rc != 0) {
00631                 CERROR("%s: Can't add uuid: rc =%d\n", lsi->lsi_svname, rc);
00632                 RETURN(rc);
00633         }
00634 
00635         OBD_ALLOC(lwpname, MTI_NAME_MAXLEN);
00636         if (lwpname == NULL)
00637                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00638 
00639         rc = tgt_name2lwp_name(lsi->lsi_svname, lwpname, MTI_NAME_MAXLEN, idx);
00640         if (rc != 0) {
00641                 CERROR("%s: failed to generate lwp name: rc = %d\n",
00642                        lsi->lsi_svname, rc);
00643                 GOTO(out, rc);
00644         }
00645 
00646         OBD_ALLOC(lwpuuid, MTI_NAME_MAXLEN);
00647         if (lwpuuid == NULL)
00648                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00649 
00650         sprintf(lwpuuid, "%s_UUID", lwpname);
00651         rc = lustre_start_simple(lwpname, LUSTRE_LWP_NAME,
00652                                  lwpuuid, lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1),
00653                                  NULL, NULL, NULL);
00654         if (rc) {
00655                 CERROR("%s: setup up failed: rc %d\n", lwpname, rc);
00656                 GOTO(out, rc);
00657         }
00658 
00659         obd = class_name2obd(lwpname);
00660         LASSERT(obd != NULL);
00661 
00662         rc = lustre_lwp_connect(obd);
00663         if (rc == 0) {
00664                 obd->u.cli.cl_max_mds_easize = MAX_MD_SIZE;
00665                 spin_lock(&lsi->lsi_lwp_lock);
00666                 list_add_tail(&obd->obd_lwp_list, &lsi->lsi_lwp_list);
00667                 spin_unlock(&lsi->lsi_lwp_lock);
00668         } else {
00669                 CERROR("%s: connect failed: rc = %d\n", lwpname, rc);
00670         }
00671 
00672         GOTO(out, rc);
00673 
00674 out:
00675         if (lwpname != NULL)
00676                 OBD_FREE(lwpname, MTI_NAME_MAXLEN);
00677         if (lwpuuid != NULL)
00678                 OBD_FREE(lwpuuid, MTI_NAME_MAXLEN);
00679 
00680         return rc;
00681 }
00682 
00683 /* the caller is responsible for memory free */
00684 static struct obd_device *lustre_find_lwp(struct lustre_sb_info *lsi,
00685                                           char **lwpname, __u32 idx)
00686 {
00687         struct obd_device       *lwp;
00688         int                      rc = 0;
00689         ENTRY;
00690 
00691         LASSERT(lwpname != NULL);
00692         LASSERT(IS_OST(lsi) || IS_MDT(lsi));
00693 
00694         OBD_ALLOC(*lwpname, MTI_NAME_MAXLEN);
00695         if (*lwpname == NULL)
00696                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00697 
00698         rc = tgt_name2lwp_name(lsi->lsi_svname, *lwpname, MTI_NAME_MAXLEN, idx);
00699         if (rc != 0) {
00700                 CERROR("%s: failed to generate lwp name: rc = %d\n",
00701                        lsi->lsi_svname, rc);
00702                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00703         }
00704 
00705         lwp = class_name2obd(*lwpname);
00706 
00707 out:
00708         if (rc != 0) {
00709                 if (*lwpname != NULL) {
00710                         OBD_FREE(*lwpname, MTI_NAME_MAXLEN);
00711                         *lwpname = NULL;
00712                 }
00713                 lwp = ERR_PTR(rc);
00714         }
00715 
00716         RETURN(lwp != NULL ? lwp : ERR_PTR(-ENOENT));
00717 }
00718 
00719 static int lustre_lwp_add_conn(struct lustre_cfg *cfg,
00720                                struct lustre_sb_info *lsi, __u32 idx)
00721 {
00722         struct lustre_cfg_bufs *bufs = NULL;
00723         struct lustre_cfg      *lcfg = NULL;
00724         char                   *lwpname = NULL;
00725         struct obd_device      *lwp;
00726         int                     rc;
00727         ENTRY;
00728 
00729         lwp = lustre_find_lwp(lsi, &lwpname, idx);
00730         if (IS_ERR(lwp)) {
00731                 CERROR("%s: can't find lwp device.\n", lsi->lsi_svname);
00732                 GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(lwp));
00733         }
00734         LASSERT(lwpname != NULL);
00735 
00736         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(bufs);
00737         if (bufs == NULL)
00738                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00739 
00740         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(bufs, lwpname);
00741         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(bufs, 1,
00742                                    lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 1));
00743 
00744         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_ADD_CONN, bufs);
00745         if (lcfg == NULL)
00746                 GOTO(out_cfg, rc = -ENOMEM);
00747         rc = class_add_conn(lwp, lcfg);
00748         if (rc)
00749                 CERROR("%s: can't add conn: rc = %d\n", lwpname, rc);
00750 
00751         if (lcfg != NULL)
00752                 lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
00753 out_cfg:
00754         if (bufs != NULL)
00755                 OBD_FREE_PTR(bufs);
00756 out:
00757         if (lwpname != NULL)
00758                 OBD_FREE(lwpname, MTI_NAME_MAXLEN);
00759         RETURN(rc);
00760 }
00761 
00780 static int client_lwp_config_process(const struct lu_env *env,
00781                                      struct llog_handle *handle,
00782                                      struct llog_rec_hdr *rec, void *data)
00783 {
00784         struct config_llog_instance *clli = data;
00785         int                          cfg_len = rec->lrh_len;
00786         char                        *cfg_buf = (char *) (rec + 1);
00787         struct lustre_cfg           *lcfg = NULL;
00788         struct lustre_sb_info       *lsi;
00789         int                          rc = 0, swab = 0;
00790         ENTRY;
00791 
00792         if (rec->lrh_type != OBD_CFG_REC) {
00793                 CERROR("Unknown llog record type %#x encountered\n",
00794                        rec->lrh_type);
00795                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00796         }
00797 
00798         LASSERT(clli->cfg_sb != NULL);
00799         lsi = s2lsi(clli->cfg_sb);
00800 
00801         lcfg = (struct lustre_cfg *)cfg_buf;
00802         if (lcfg->lcfg_version == __swab32(LUSTRE_CFG_VERSION)) {
00803                 lustre_swab_lustre_cfg(lcfg);
00804                 swab = 1;
00805         }
00806 
00807         rc = lustre_cfg_sanity_check(cfg_buf, cfg_len);
00808         if (rc)
00809                 GOTO(out, rc);
00810 
00811         switch (lcfg->lcfg_command) {
00812         case LCFG_MARKER: {
00813                 struct cfg_marker *marker = lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, 1);
00814 
00815                 lustre_swab_cfg_marker(marker, swab,
00816                                        LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 1));
00817                 if (marker->cm_flags & CM_SKIP ||
00818                     marker->cm_flags & CM_EXCLUDE)
00819                         GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00820 
00821                 if (!tgt_is_mdt(marker->cm_tgtname, &clli->cfg_lwp_idx))
00822                         GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00823 
00824                 if (IS_MDT(lsi) && clli->cfg_lwp_idx != 0)
00825                         GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00826 
00827                 if (!strncmp(marker->cm_comment, "add mdc", 7) ||
00828                     !strncmp(marker->cm_comment, "add failnid", 11)) {
00829                         if (marker->cm_flags & CM_START) {
00830                                 clli->cfg_flags = CFG_F_MARKER;
00831                                 /* This hack is to differentiate the
00832                                  * ADD_UUID is come from "add mdc" record
00833                                  * or from "add failnid" record. */
00834                                 if (!strncmp(marker->cm_comment,
00835                                              "add failnid", 11))
00836                                         clli->cfg_flags |= CFG_F_SKIP;
00837                         } else if (marker->cm_flags & CM_END) {
00838                                 clli->cfg_flags = 0;
00839                         }
00840                 }
00841                 break;
00842         }
00843         case LCFG_ADD_UUID: {
00844                 if (clli->cfg_flags == CFG_F_MARKER) {
00845                         rc = lustre_lwp_setup(lcfg, lsi, clli->cfg_lwp_idx);
00846                         /* XXX: process only the first nid as
00847                          * we don't need another instance of lwp */
00848                         clli->cfg_flags |= CFG_F_SKIP;
00849                 } else if (clli->cfg_flags == (CFG_F_MARKER | CFG_F_SKIP)) {
00850                         rc = class_add_uuid(lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1),
00851                                             lcfg->lcfg_nid);
00852                         if (rc)
00853                                 CERROR("%s: Fail to add uuid, rc:%d\n",
00854                                        lsi->lsi_svname, rc);
00855                 }
00856                 break;
00857         }
00858         case LCFG_ADD_CONN: {
00859                 char *devname = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 0);
00860                 char *ptr;
00861                 __u32 idx     = 0;
00862 
00863                 if (!is_mdc_device(devname))
00864                         break;
00865 
00866                 ptr = strrchr(devname, '-');
00867                 if (ptr == NULL)
00868                         break;
00869 
00870                 *ptr = 0;
00871                 if (!tgt_is_mdt(devname, &idx)) {
00872                         *ptr = '-';
00873                         break;
00874                 }
00875                 *ptr = '-';
00876 
00877                 if (IS_MDT(lsi) && idx != 0)
00878                         break;
00879 
00880                 rc = lustre_lwp_add_conn(lcfg, lsi, idx);
00881                 break;
00882         }
00883         default:
00884                 break;
00885         }
00886 out:
00887         RETURN(rc);
00888 }
00889 
00890 static int lustre_disconnect_lwp(struct super_block *sb)
00891 {
00892         struct lustre_sb_info           *lsi     = s2lsi(sb);
00893         struct obd_device               *lwp;
00894         char                            *logname = NULL;
00895         struct lustre_cfg_bufs          *bufs    = NULL;
00896         struct config_llog_instance     *cfg     = NULL;
00897         int                              rc      = 0;
00898         int                              rc1     = 0;
00899         ENTRY;
00900 
00901         if (likely(lsi->lsi_lwp_started)) {
00902                 OBD_ALLOC(logname, MTI_NAME_MAXLEN);
00903                 if (logname == NULL)
00904                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00905 
00906                 rc = server_name2fsname(lsi->lsi_svname, logname, NULL);
00907                 if (rc != 0) {
00908                         CERROR("%s: failed to get fsname from svname: "
00909                                "rc = %d\n", lsi->lsi_svname, rc);
00910                         GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00911                 }
00912 
00913                 strcat(logname, "-client");
00914                 OBD_ALLOC_PTR(cfg);
00915                 if (cfg == NULL)
00916                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00917 
00918                 /* end log first */
00919                 cfg->cfg_instance = sb;
00920                 rc = lustre_end_log(sb, logname, cfg);
00921                 if (rc != 0 && rc != -ENOENT)
00922                         GOTO(out, rc);
00923 
00924                 lsi->lsi_lwp_started = 0;
00925         }
00926 
00927         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(bufs);
00928         if (bufs == NULL)
00929                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00930 
00931         list_for_each_entry(lwp, &lsi->lsi_lwp_list, obd_lwp_list) {
00932                 struct lustre_cfg *lcfg;
00933 
00934                 if (likely(lwp->obd_lwp_export != NULL)) {
00935                         class_export_put(lwp->obd_lwp_export);
00936                         lwp->obd_lwp_export = NULL;
00937                 }
00938 
00939                 lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(bufs, lwp->obd_name);
00940                 lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(bufs, 1, NULL);
00941                 lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_CLEANUP, bufs);
00942                 if (lcfg == NULL)
00943                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00944 
00945                 /* Disconnect import first. NULL is passed for the '@env',
00946                  * since it will not be used. */
00947                 rc = lwp->obd_lu_dev->ld_ops->ldo_process_config(NULL,
00948                                                         lwp->obd_lu_dev, lcfg);
00949                 lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
00950                 if (rc != 0 && rc != -ETIMEDOUT) {
00951                         CERROR("%s: fail to disconnect LWP: rc = %d\n",
00952                                lwp->obd_name, rc);
00953                         rc1 = rc;
00954                 }
00955         }
00956 
00957         GOTO(out, rc);
00958 
00959 out:
00960         if (bufs != NULL)
00961                 OBD_FREE_PTR(bufs);
00962         if (cfg != NULL)
00963                 OBD_FREE_PTR(cfg);
00964         if (logname != NULL)
00965                 OBD_FREE(logname, MTI_NAME_MAXLEN);
00966 
00967         return rc1 != 0 ? rc1 : rc;
00968 }
00969 
00973 static int lustre_stop_lwp(struct super_block *sb)
00974 {
00975         struct lustre_sb_info   *lsi = s2lsi(sb);
00976         struct obd_device       *lwp;
00977         int                      rc  = 0;
00978         int                      rc1 = 0;
00979         ENTRY;
00980 
00981         while (!list_empty(&lsi->lsi_lwp_list)) {
00982                 lwp = list_entry(lsi->lsi_lwp_list.next, struct obd_device,
00983                                  obd_lwp_list);
00984                 list_del_init(&lwp->obd_lwp_list);
00985                 lwp->obd_force = 1;
00986                 rc = class_manual_cleanup(lwp);
00987                 if (rc != 0) {
00988                         CERROR("%s: fail to stop LWP: rc = %d\n",
00989                                lwp->obd_name, rc);
00990                         rc1 = rc;
00991                 }
00992         }
00993 
00994         RETURN(rc1 != 0 ? rc1 : rc);
00995 }
00996 
01000 static int lustre_start_lwp(struct super_block *sb)
01001 {
01002         struct lustre_sb_info       *lsi = s2lsi(sb);
01003         struct config_llog_instance *cfg = NULL;
01004         char                        *logname;
01005         int                          rc;
01006         ENTRY;
01007 
01008         if (unlikely(lsi->lsi_lwp_started))
01009                 RETURN(0);
01010 
01011         OBD_ALLOC(logname, MTI_NAME_MAXLEN);
01012         if (logname == NULL)
01013                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01014 
01015         rc = server_name2fsname(lsi->lsi_svname, logname, NULL);
01016         if (rc != 0) {
01017                 CERROR("%s: failed to get fsname from svname: rc = %d\n",
01018                        lsi->lsi_svname, rc);
01019                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01020         }
01021 
01022         strcat(logname, "-client");
01023         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(cfg);
01024         if (cfg == NULL)
01025                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01026 
01027         cfg->cfg_callback = client_lwp_config_process;
01028         cfg->cfg_instance = sb;
01029         rc = lustre_process_log(sb, logname, cfg);
01030         /* need to remove config llog from mgc */
01031         lsi->lsi_lwp_started = 1;
01032 
01033         GOTO(out, rc);
01034 
01035 out:
01036         OBD_FREE(logname, MTI_NAME_MAXLEN);
01037         if (cfg != NULL)
01038                 OBD_FREE_PTR(cfg);
01039 
01040         return rc;
01041 }
01042 
01043 static DEFINE_MUTEX(server_start_lock);
01044 
01045 /* Stop MDS/OSS if nobody is using them */
01046 static int server_stop_servers(int lsiflags)
01047 {
01048         struct obd_device *obd = NULL;
01049         struct obd_type *type = NULL;
01050         int rc = 0;
01051         ENTRY;
01052 
01053         mutex_lock(&server_start_lock);
01054 
01055         /* Either an MDT or an OST or neither  */
01056         /* if this was an MDT, and there are no more MDT's, clean up the MDS */
01057         if (lsiflags & LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MDT) {
01058                 obd = class_name2obd(LUSTRE_MDS_OBDNAME);
01059                 if (obd != NULL)
01060                         type = class_search_type(LUSTRE_MDT_NAME);
01061         }
01062 
01063         /* if this was an OST, and there are no more OST's, clean up the OSS */
01064         if (lsiflags & LDD_F_SV_TYPE_OST) {
01065                 obd = class_name2obd(LUSTRE_OSS_OBDNAME);
01066                 if (obd != NULL)
01067                         type = class_search_type(LUSTRE_OST_NAME);
01068         }
01069 
01070         if (obd != NULL && (type == NULL || type->typ_refcnt == 0)) {
01071                 obd->obd_force = 1;
01072                 /* obd_fail doesn't mean much on a server obd */
01073                 rc = class_manual_cleanup(obd);
01074         }
01075 
01076         mutex_unlock(&server_start_lock);
01077 
01078         RETURN(rc);
01079 }
01080 
01081 int server_mti_print(const char *title, struct mgs_target_info *mti)
01082 {
01083         PRINT_CMD(PRINT_MASK, "mti %s\n", title);
01084         PRINT_CMD(PRINT_MASK, "server: %s\n", mti->mti_svname);
01085         PRINT_CMD(PRINT_MASK, "fs:     %s\n", mti->mti_fsname);
01086         PRINT_CMD(PRINT_MASK, "uuid:   %s\n", mti->mti_uuid);
01087         PRINT_CMD(PRINT_MASK, "ver: %d  flags: %#x\n",
01088                   mti->mti_config_ver, mti->mti_flags);
01089         return 0;
01090 }
01091 
01092 /* Generate data for registration */
01093 static int server_lsi2mti(struct lustre_sb_info *lsi,
01094                           struct mgs_target_info *mti)
01095 {
01096         lnet_process_id_t id;
01097         int rc, i = 0;
01098         int cplen = 0;
01099         ENTRY;
01100 
01101         if (!IS_SERVER(lsi))
01102                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01103 
01104         if (strlcpy(mti->mti_svname, lsi->lsi_svname, sizeof(mti->mti_svname))
01105             >= sizeof(mti->mti_svname))
01106                 RETURN(-E2BIG);
01107 
01108         mti->mti_nid_count = 0;
01109         while (LNetGetId(i++, &id) != -ENOENT) {
01110                 if (LNET_NETTYP(LNET_NIDNET(id.nid)) == LOLND)
01111                         continue;
01112 
01113                 /* server use --servicenode param, only allow specified
01114                  * nids be registered */
01115                 if ((lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_flags & LMD_FLG_NO_PRIMNODE) != 0 &&
01116                     class_match_nid(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_params,
01117                                     PARAM_FAILNODE, id.nid) < 1)
01118                         continue;
01119 
01120                 /* match specified network */
01121                 if (!class_match_net(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_params,
01122                                      PARAM_NETWORK, LNET_NIDNET(id.nid)))
01123                         continue;
01124 
01125                 mti->mti_nids[mti->mti_nid_count] = id.nid;
01126                 mti->mti_nid_count++;
01127                 if (mti->mti_nid_count >= MTI_NIDS_MAX) {
01128                         CWARN("Only using first %d nids for %s\n",
01129                               mti->mti_nid_count, mti->mti_svname);
01130                         break;
01131                 }
01132         }
01133 
01134         if (mti->mti_nid_count == 0) {
01135                 CERROR("Failed to get NID for server %s, please check whether "
01136                        "the target is specifed with improper --servicenode or "
01137                        "--network options.\n", mti->mti_svname);
01138                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01139         }
01140 
01141         mti->mti_lustre_ver = LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE;
01142         mti->mti_config_ver = 0;
01143 
01144         rc = server_name2fsname(lsi->lsi_svname, mti->mti_fsname, NULL);
01145         if (rc != 0)
01146                 return rc;
01147 
01148         rc = server_name2index(lsi->lsi_svname, &mti->mti_stripe_index, NULL);
01149         if (rc < 0)
01150                 return rc;
01151         /* Orion requires index to be set */
01152         LASSERT(!(rc & LDD_F_NEED_INDEX));
01153         /* keep only LDD flags */
01154         mti->mti_flags = lsi->lsi_flags & LDD_F_MASK;
01155         if (mti->mti_flags & (LDD_F_WRITECONF | LDD_F_VIRGIN))
01156                 mti->mti_flags |= LDD_F_UPDATE;
01157         cplen = strlcpy(mti->mti_params, lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_params,
01158                         sizeof(mti->mti_params));
01159         if (cplen >= sizeof(mti->mti_params))
01160                 return -E2BIG;
01161         return 0;
01162 }
01163 
01164 /* Register an old or new target with the MGS. If needed MGS will construct
01165    startup logs and assign index */
01166 static int server_register_target(struct lustre_sb_info *lsi)
01167 {
01168         struct obd_device *mgc = lsi->lsi_mgc;
01169         struct mgs_target_info *mti = NULL;
01170         bool writeconf;
01171         int rc;
01172         ENTRY;
01173 
01174         LASSERT(mgc);
01175 
01176         if (!IS_SERVER(lsi))
01177                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01178 
01179         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(mti);
01180         if (!mti)
01181                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01182 
01183         rc = server_lsi2mti(lsi, mti);
01184         if (rc)
01185                 GOTO(out, rc);
01186 
01187         CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "Registration %s, fs=%s, %s, index=%04x, flags=%#x\n",
01188                mti->mti_svname, mti->mti_fsname,
01189                libcfs_nid2str(mti->mti_nids[0]), mti->mti_stripe_index,
01190                mti->mti_flags);
01191 
01192         /* if write_conf is true, the registration must succeed */
01193         writeconf = !!(lsi->lsi_flags & (LDD_F_NEED_INDEX | LDD_F_UPDATE));
01194         mti->mti_flags |= LDD_F_OPC_REG;
01195 
01196         /* Register the target */
01197         /* FIXME use mgc_process_config instead */
01198         rc = obd_set_info_async(NULL, mgc->u.cli.cl_mgc_mgsexp,
01199                                 sizeof(KEY_REGISTER_TARGET),
01200                                 KEY_REGISTER_TARGET,
01201                                 sizeof(*mti), mti, NULL);
01202         if (rc) {
01203                 if (mti->mti_flags & LDD_F_ERROR) {
01204                         LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x160,
01205                                 "%s: the MGS refuses to allow this server "
01206                                 "to start: rc = %d. Please see messages on "
01207                                 "the MGS.\n", lsi->lsi_svname, rc);
01208                 } else if (writeconf) {
01209                         LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x15f,
01210                                 "%s: cannot register this server with the MGS: "
01211                                 "rc = %d. Is the MGS running?\n",
01212                                 lsi->lsi_svname, rc);
01213                 } else {
01214                         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: error registering with the MGS: "
01215                                "rc = %d (not fatal)\n", lsi->lsi_svname, rc);
01216                         /* reset the error code for non-fatal error. */
01217                         rc = 0;
01218                 }
01219                 GOTO(out, rc);
01220         }
01221 
01222 out:
01223         if (mti)
01224                 OBD_FREE_PTR(mti);
01225         RETURN(rc);
01226 }
01227 
01232 static int server_notify_target(struct super_block *sb, struct obd_device *obd)
01233 {
01234         struct lustre_sb_info *lsi = s2lsi(sb);
01235         struct obd_device *mgc = lsi->lsi_mgc;
01236         struct mgs_target_info *mti = NULL;
01237         int rc;
01238         ENTRY;
01239 
01240         LASSERT(mgc);
01241 
01242         if (!(IS_SERVER(lsi)))
01243                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01244 
01245         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(mti);
01246         if (!mti)
01247                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01248         rc = server_lsi2mti(lsi, mti);
01249         if (rc)
01250                 GOTO(out, rc);
01251 
01252         mti->mti_instance = obd->u.obt.obt_instance;
01253         mti->mti_flags |= LDD_F_OPC_READY;
01254 
01255         /* FIXME use mgc_process_config instead */
01256         rc = obd_set_info_async(NULL, mgc->u.cli.cl_mgc_mgsexp,
01257                                 sizeof(KEY_REGISTER_TARGET),
01258                                 KEY_REGISTER_TARGET,
01259                                 sizeof(*mti), mti, NULL);
01260 
01261         /* Imperative recovery: if the mgs informs us to use IR? */
01262         if (!rc && !(mti->mti_flags & LDD_F_ERROR) &&
01263             (mti->mti_flags & LDD_F_IR_CAPABLE))
01264                 lsi->lsi_flags |= LDD_F_IR_CAPABLE;
01265 
01266 out:
01267         if (mti)
01268                 OBD_FREE_PTR(mti);
01269         RETURN(rc);
01270 
01271 }
01272 
01275 static int server_start_targets(struct super_block *sb)
01276 {
01277         struct obd_device *obd;
01278         struct lustre_sb_info *lsi = s2lsi(sb);
01279         struct config_llog_instance cfg;
01280         struct lu_env mgc_env;
01281         struct lu_device *dev;
01282         int rc;
01283         ENTRY;
01284 
01285         CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "starting target %s\n", lsi->lsi_svname);
01286 
01287         if (IS_MDT(lsi)) {
01288                 /* make sure the MDS is started */
01289                 mutex_lock(&server_start_lock);
01290                 obd = class_name2obd(LUSTRE_MDS_OBDNAME);
01291                 if (!obd) {
01292                         rc = lustre_start_simple(LUSTRE_MDS_OBDNAME,
01293                                                  LUSTRE_MDS_NAME,
01294                                                  LUSTRE_MDS_OBDNAME"_uuid",
01295                                                  NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
01296                         if (rc) {
01297                                 mutex_unlock(&server_start_lock);
01298                                 CERROR("failed to start MDS: %d\n", rc);
01299                                 RETURN(rc);
01300                         }
01301                 }
01302                 mutex_unlock(&server_start_lock);
01303         }
01304 
01305         /* If we're an OST, make sure the global OSS is running */
01306         if (IS_OST(lsi)) {
01307                 /* make sure OSS is started */
01308                 mutex_lock(&server_start_lock);
01309                 obd = class_name2obd(LUSTRE_OSS_OBDNAME);
01310                 if (!obd) {
01311                         rc = lustre_start_simple(LUSTRE_OSS_OBDNAME,
01312                                                  LUSTRE_OSS_NAME,
01313                                                  LUSTRE_OSS_OBDNAME"_uuid",
01314                                                  NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
01315                         if (rc) {
01316                                 mutex_unlock(&server_start_lock);
01317                                 CERROR("failed to start OSS: %d\n", rc);
01318                                 RETURN(rc);
01319                         }
01320                 }
01321                 mutex_unlock(&server_start_lock);
01322         }
01323 
01324         rc = lu_env_init(&mgc_env, LCT_MG_THREAD);
01325         if (rc != 0)
01326                 GOTO(out_stop_service, rc);
01327 
01328         /* Set the mgc fs to our server disk.  This allows the MGC to
01329          * read and write configs locally, in case it can't talk to the MGS. */
01330         rc = server_mgc_set_fs(&mgc_env, lsi->lsi_mgc, sb);
01331         if (rc)
01332                 GOTO(out_env, rc);
01333 
01334         /* Register with MGS */
01335         rc = server_register_target(lsi);
01336         if (rc)
01337                 GOTO(out_mgc, rc);
01338 
01339         /* Let the target look up the mount using the target's name
01340            (we can't pass the sb or mnt through class_process_config.) */
01341         rc = server_register_mount(lsi->lsi_svname, sb);
01342         if (rc)
01343                 GOTO(out_mgc, rc);
01344 
01345         /* Start targets using the llog named for the target */
01346         memset(&cfg, 0, sizeof(cfg));
01347         cfg.cfg_callback = class_config_llog_handler;
01348         rc = lustre_process_log(sb, lsi->lsi_svname, &cfg);
01349         if (rc) {
01350                 CERROR("failed to start server %s: %d\n",
01351                        lsi->lsi_svname, rc);
01352                 /* Do NOT call server_deregister_mount() here. This makes it
01353                  * impossible to find mount later in cleanup time and leaves
01354                  * @lsi and othder stuff leaked. -umka */
01355                 GOTO(out_mgc, rc);
01356         }
01357 
01358         obd = class_name2obd(lsi->lsi_svname);
01359         if (!obd) {
01360                 CERROR("no server named %s was started\n", lsi->lsi_svname);
01361                 GOTO(out_mgc, rc = -ENXIO);
01362         }
01363 
01364         if (IS_OST(lsi) || IS_MDT(lsi)) {
01365                 rc = lustre_start_lwp(sb);
01366                 if (rc) {
01367                         CERROR("%s: failed to start LWP: %d\n",
01368                                lsi->lsi_svname, rc);
01369                         GOTO(out_mgc, rc);
01370                 }
01371         }
01372 
01373         server_notify_target(sb, obd);
01374 
01375         /* calculate recovery timeout, do it after lustre_process_log */
01376         server_calc_timeout(lsi, obd);
01377 
01378         /* log has been fully processed */
01379         obd_notify(obd, NULL, OBD_NOTIFY_CONFIG, (void *)CONFIG_LOG);
01380 
01381         /* log has been fully processed, let clients connect */
01382         dev = obd->obd_lu_dev;
01383         if (dev && dev->ld_ops->ldo_prepare) {
01384                 struct lu_env env;
01385 
01386                 rc = lu_env_init(&env, dev->ld_type->ldt_ctx_tags);
01387                 if (rc == 0) {
01388                         struct lu_context  session_ctx;
01389 
01390                         lu_context_init(&session_ctx, LCT_SERVER_SESSION);
01391                         session_ctx.lc_thread = NULL;
01392                         lu_context_enter(&session_ctx);
01393                         env.le_ses = &session_ctx;
01394 
01395                         rc = dev->ld_ops->ldo_prepare(&env, NULL, dev);
01396 
01397                         lu_env_fini(&env);
01398                         lu_context_exit(&session_ctx);
01399                         lu_context_fini(&session_ctx);
01400                 }
01401         }
01402 
01403         /* abort recovery only on the complete stack:
01404          * many devices can be involved */
01405         if ((lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_flags & LMD_FLG_ABORT_RECOV) &&
01406             (OBP(obd, iocontrol))) {
01407                 obd_iocontrol(OBD_IOC_ABORT_RECOVERY, obd->obd_self_export, 0,
01408                               NULL, NULL);
01409         }
01410 
01411 out_mgc:
01412         /* Release the mgc fs for others to use */
01413         server_mgc_clear_fs(&mgc_env, lsi->lsi_mgc);
01414 out_env:
01415         lu_env_fini(&mgc_env);
01416 out_stop_service:
01417         if (rc != 0)
01418                 server_stop_servers(lsi->lsi_flags);
01419 
01420         RETURN(rc);
01421 }
01422 
01423 static int lsi_prepare(struct lustre_sb_info *lsi)
01424 {
01425         const char *osd_type;
01426         const char *fstype;
01427         __u32 index;
01428         int rc;
01429         ENTRY;
01430 
01431         LASSERT(lsi);
01432         LASSERT(lsi->lsi_lmd);
01433 
01434         /* The server name is given as a mount line option */
01435         if (lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_profile == NULL) {
01436                 LCONSOLE_ERROR("Can't determine server name\n");
01437                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01438         }
01439 
01440         /* Determine osd type */
01441         if (lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_osd_type == NULL) {
01442                 osd_type = LUSTRE_OSD_LDISKFS_NAME;
01443                 fstype = "ldiskfs";
01444         } else {
01445                 osd_type = lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_osd_type;
01446                 fstype = lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_osd_type;
01447         }
01448 
01449         if (strlen(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_profile) >= sizeof(lsi->lsi_svname) ||
01450             strlen(osd_type) >= sizeof(lsi->lsi_osd_type) ||
01451             strlen(fstype) >= sizeof(lsi->lsi_fstype))
01452                 RETURN(-ENAMETOOLONG);
01453 
01454         strlcpy(lsi->lsi_svname, lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_profile,
01455                 sizeof(lsi->lsi_svname));
01456         strlcpy(lsi->lsi_osd_type, osd_type, sizeof(lsi->lsi_osd_type));
01457         /* XXX: a temp. solution for components using ldiskfs
01458          *      to be removed in one of the subsequent patches */
01459         strlcpy(lsi->lsi_fstype, fstype, sizeof(lsi->lsi_fstype));
01460 
01461         /* Determine server type */
01462         rc = server_name2index(lsi->lsi_svname, &index, NULL);
01463         if (rc < 0) {
01464                 if (lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_flags & LMD_FLG_MGS) {
01465                         /* Assume we're a bare MGS */
01466                         rc = 0;
01467                         lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_flags |= LMD_FLG_NOSVC;
01468                 } else {
01469                         LCONSOLE_ERROR("Can't determine server type of '%s'\n",
01470                                        lsi->lsi_svname);
01471                         RETURN(rc);
01472                 }
01473         }
01474         lsi->lsi_flags |= rc;
01475 
01476         /* Add mount line flags that used to be in ldd:
01477          * writeconf, mgs, anything else?
01478          */
01479         lsi->lsi_flags |= (lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_flags & LMD_FLG_WRITECONF) ?
01480                 LDD_F_WRITECONF : 0;
01481         lsi->lsi_flags |= (lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_flags & LMD_FLG_VIRGIN) ?
01482                 LDD_F_VIRGIN : 0;
01483         lsi->lsi_flags |= (lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_flags & LMD_FLG_UPDATE) ?
01484                 LDD_F_UPDATE : 0;
01485         lsi->lsi_flags |= (lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_flags & LMD_FLG_MGS) ?
01486                 LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MGS : 0;
01487         lsi->lsi_flags |= (lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_flags & LMD_FLG_NO_PRIMNODE) ?
01488                 LDD_F_NO_PRIMNODE : 0;
01489 
01490         RETURN(0);
01491 }
01492 
01493 /*************** server mount ******************/
01494 
01497 static void server_put_super(struct super_block *sb)
01498 {
01499         struct lustre_sb_info *lsi = s2lsi(sb);
01500         struct obd_device     *obd;
01501         char *tmpname, *extraname = NULL;
01502         int tmpname_sz;
01503         int lsiflags = lsi->lsi_flags;
01504         ENTRY;
01505 
01506         LASSERT(IS_SERVER(lsi));
01507 
01508         tmpname_sz = strlen(lsi->lsi_svname) + 1;
01509         OBD_ALLOC(tmpname, tmpname_sz);
01510         memcpy(tmpname, lsi->lsi_svname, tmpname_sz);
01511         CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "server put_super %s\n", tmpname);
01512         if (IS_MDT(lsi) && (lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_flags & LMD_FLG_NOSVC))
01513                 snprintf(tmpname, tmpname_sz, "MGS");
01514 
01515         /* disconnect the lwp first to drain off the inflight request */
01516         if (IS_OST(lsi) || IS_MDT(lsi)) {
01517                 int     rc;
01518 
01519                 rc = lustre_disconnect_lwp(sb);
01520                 if (rc != 0 && rc != -ETIMEDOUT &&
01521                     rc != -ENOTCONN && rc != -ESHUTDOWN)
01522                         CWARN("%s: failed to disconnect lwp: rc= %d\n",
01523                               tmpname, rc);
01524         }
01525 
01526         /* Stop the target */
01527         if (!(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_flags & LMD_FLG_NOSVC) &&
01528             (IS_MDT(lsi) || IS_OST(lsi))) {
01529                 struct lustre_profile *lprof = NULL;
01530 
01531                 /* tell the mgc to drop the config log */
01532                 lustre_end_log(sb, lsi->lsi_svname, NULL);
01533 
01534                 /* COMPAT_146 - profile may get deleted in mgc_cleanup.
01535                    If there are any setup/cleanup errors, save the lov
01536                    name for safety cleanup later. */
01537                 lprof = class_get_profile(lsi->lsi_svname);
01538                 if (lprof != NULL) {
01539                         if (lprof->lp_dt != NULL) {
01540                                 OBD_ALLOC(extraname, strlen(lprof->lp_dt) + 1);
01541                                 strncpy(extraname, lprof->lp_dt,
01542                                         strlen(lprof->lp_dt) + 1);
01543                         }
01544                         class_put_profile(lprof);
01545                 }
01546 
01547                 obd = class_name2obd(lsi->lsi_svname);
01548                 if (obd) {
01549                         CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "stopping %s\n", obd->obd_name);
01550                         if (lsiflags & LSI_UMOUNT_FAILOVER)
01551                                 obd->obd_fail = 1;
01552                         /* We can't seem to give an error return code
01553                          * to .put_super, so we better make sure we clean up! */
01554                         obd->obd_force = 1;
01555                         class_manual_cleanup(obd);
01556                 } else {
01557                         CERROR("no obd %s\n", lsi->lsi_svname);
01558                         server_deregister_mount(lsi->lsi_svname);
01559                 }
01560         }
01561 
01562         /* If they wanted the mgs to stop separately from the mdt, they
01563            should have put it on a different device. */
01564         if (IS_MGS(lsi)) {
01565                 /* if MDS start with --nomgs, don't stop MGS then */
01566                 if (!(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_flags & LMD_FLG_NOMGS))
01567                         server_stop_mgs(sb);
01568         }
01569 
01570         if (IS_OST(lsi) || IS_MDT(lsi)) {
01571                 if (lustre_stop_lwp(sb) < 0)
01572                         CERROR("%s: failed to stop lwp!\n", tmpname);
01573         }
01574 
01575         /* Clean the mgc and sb */
01576         lustre_common_put_super(sb);
01577 
01578         /* wait till all in-progress cleanups are done
01579          * specifically we're interested in ofd cleanup
01580          * as it pins OSS */
01581         obd_zombie_barrier();
01582 
01583         /* Stop the servers (MDS, OSS) if no longer needed.  We must wait
01584            until the target is really gone so that our type refcount check
01585            is right. */
01586         server_stop_servers(lsiflags);
01587 
01588         /* In case of startup or cleanup err, stop related obds */
01589         if (extraname) {
01590                 obd = class_name2obd(extraname);
01591                 if (obd) {
01592                         CWARN("Cleaning orphaned obd %s\n", extraname);
01593                         obd->obd_force = 1;
01594                         class_manual_cleanup(obd);
01595                 }
01596                 OBD_FREE(extraname, strlen(extraname) + 1);
01597         }
01598 
01599         LCONSOLE_WARN("server umount %s complete\n", tmpname);
01600         OBD_FREE(tmpname, tmpname_sz);
01601         EXIT;
01602 }
01603 
01606 static void server_umount_begin(struct super_block *sb)
01607 {
01608         struct lustre_sb_info *lsi = s2lsi(sb);
01609         ENTRY;
01610 
01611         CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "umount -f\n");
01612         /* umount = failover
01613            umount -f = force
01614            no third way to do non-force, non-failover */
01615         lsi->lsi_flags &= ~LSI_UMOUNT_FAILOVER;
01616         EXIT;
01617 }
01618 
01619 static int server_statfs(struct dentry *dentry, struct kstatfs *buf)
01620 {
01621         struct super_block *sb = dentry->d_sb;
01622         struct lustre_sb_info *lsi = s2lsi(sb);
01623         struct obd_statfs statfs;
01624         int rc;
01625         ENTRY;
01626 
01627         if (lsi->lsi_dt_dev) {
01628                 rc = dt_statfs(NULL, lsi->lsi_dt_dev, &statfs);
01629                 if (rc == 0) {
01630                         statfs_unpack(buf, &statfs);
01631                         buf->f_type = sb->s_magic;
01632                         RETURN(0);
01633                 }
01634         }
01635 
01636         /* just return 0 */
01637         buf->f_type = sb->s_magic;
01638         buf->f_bsize = sb->s_blocksize;
01639         buf->f_blocks = 1;
01640         buf->f_bfree = 0;
01641         buf->f_bavail = 0;
01642         buf->f_files = 1;
01643         buf->f_ffree = 0;
01644         buf->f_namelen = NAME_MAX;
01645         RETURN(0);
01646 }
01647 
01651 static struct super_operations server_ops = {
01652         .put_super      = server_put_super,
01653         .umount_begin   = server_umount_begin, /* umount -f */
01654         .statfs         = server_statfs,
01655 };
01656 
01657 /*
01658  * Xattr support for Lustre servers
01659  */
01660 static ssize_t lustre_getxattr(struct dentry *dentry, const char *name,
01661                                 void *buffer, size_t size)
01662 {
01663         if (!selinux_is_enabled())
01664                 return -EOPNOTSUPP;
01665         return -ENODATA;
01666 }
01667 
01668 static int lustre_setxattr(struct dentry *dentry, const char *name,
01669                             const void *value, size_t size, int flags)
01670 {
01671         return -EOPNOTSUPP;
01672 }
01673 
01674 static ssize_t lustre_listxattr(struct dentry *d_entry, char *name,
01675                                 size_t size)
01676 {
01677         return -EOPNOTSUPP;
01678 }
01679 
01680 static const struct inode_operations server_inode_operations = {
01681         .setxattr       = lustre_setxattr,
01682         .getxattr       = lustre_getxattr,
01683         .listxattr      = lustre_listxattr,
01684 };
01685 
01686 #define log2(n) ffz(~(n))
01687 #define LUSTRE_SUPER_MAGIC 0x0BD00BD1
01688 
01689 static int server_fill_super_common(struct super_block *sb)
01690 {
01691         struct inode *root = NULL;
01692         ENTRY;
01693 
01694         CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "Server sb, dev=%d\n", (int)sb->s_dev);
01695 
01696         sb->s_blocksize = 4096;
01697         sb->s_blocksize_bits = log2(sb->s_blocksize);
01698         sb->s_magic = LUSTRE_SUPER_MAGIC;
01699         sb->s_maxbytes = 0; /* we don't allow file IO on server mountpoints */
01700         sb->s_flags |= MS_RDONLY;
01701         sb->s_op = &server_ops;
01702 
01703         root = new_inode(sb);
01704         if (!root) {
01705                 CERROR("Can't make root inode\n");
01706                 RETURN(-EIO);
01707         }
01708 
01709         /* returns -EIO for every operation */
01710         /* make_bad_inode(root); -- badness - can't umount */
01711         /* apparently we need to be a directory for the mount to finish */
01712         root->i_mode = S_IFDIR;
01713         root->i_op = &server_inode_operations;
01714         sb->s_root = d_make_root(root);
01715         if (!sb->s_root) {
01716                 CERROR("%s: can't make root dentry\n", sb->s_id);
01717                 RETURN(-EIO);
01718         }
01719 
01720         RETURN(0);
01721 }
01722 
01723 static int osd_start(struct lustre_sb_info *lsi, unsigned long mflags)
01724 {
01725         struct lustre_mount_data *lmd = lsi->lsi_lmd;
01726         struct obd_device        *obd;
01727         struct dt_device_param    p;
01728         char                      flagstr[16];
01729         int                       rc;
01730         ENTRY;
01731 
01732         CDEBUG(D_MOUNT,
01733                "Attempting to start %s, type=%s, lsifl=%x, mountfl=%lx\n",
01734                lsi->lsi_svname, lsi->lsi_osd_type, lsi->lsi_flags, mflags);
01735 
01736         sprintf(lsi->lsi_osd_obdname, "%s-osd", lsi->lsi_svname);
01737         strcpy(lsi->lsi_osd_uuid, lsi->lsi_osd_obdname);
01738         strcat(lsi->lsi_osd_uuid, "_UUID");
01739         sprintf(flagstr, "%lu:%lu", mflags, (unsigned long) lmd->lmd_flags);
01740 
01741         obd = class_name2obd(lsi->lsi_osd_obdname);
01742         if (obd == NULL) {
01743                 rc = lustre_start_simple(lsi->lsi_osd_obdname,
01744                                          lsi->lsi_osd_type,
01745                                          lsi->lsi_osd_uuid, lmd->lmd_dev,
01746                                          flagstr, lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_opts,
01747                                          lsi->lsi_svname);
01748                 if (rc)
01749                         GOTO(out, rc);
01750                 obd = class_name2obd(lsi->lsi_osd_obdname);
01751                 LASSERT(obd);
01752         } else {
01753                 CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "%s already started\n", lsi->lsi_osd_obdname);
01754                 /* but continue setup to allow special case of MDT and internal
01755                  * MGT being started separately. */
01756                 if (!((IS_MGS(lsi) && (lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_flags &
01757                                       LMD_FLG_NOMGS)) ||
01758                      (IS_MDT(lsi) && (lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_flags &
01759                                       LMD_FLG_NOSVC))))
01760                         RETURN(-EALREADY);
01761         }
01762 
01763         rc = obd_connect(NULL, &lsi->lsi_osd_exp,
01764                          obd, &obd->obd_uuid, NULL, NULL);
01765 
01766         if (rc) {
01767                 obd->obd_force = 1;
01768                 class_manual_cleanup(obd);
01769                 lsi->lsi_dt_dev = NULL;
01770                 RETURN(rc);
01771         }
01772 
01773         LASSERT(obd->obd_lu_dev);
01774         lu_device_get(obd->obd_lu_dev);
01775         lsi->lsi_dt_dev = lu2dt_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
01776         LASSERT(lsi->lsi_dt_dev);
01777 
01778         /* set disk context for llog usage */
01779         OBD_SET_CTXT_MAGIC(&obd->obd_lvfs_ctxt);
01780         obd->obd_lvfs_ctxt.dt = lsi->lsi_dt_dev;
01781 
01782         dt_conf_get(NULL, lsi->lsi_dt_dev, &p);
01783 out:
01784         RETURN(rc);
01785 }
01786 
01792 int server_fill_super(struct super_block *sb)
01793 {
01794         struct lustre_sb_info *lsi = s2lsi(sb);
01795         int rc;
01796         ENTRY;
01797 
01798         /* to simulate target mount race */
01799         OBD_RACE(OBD_FAIL_TGT_MOUNT_RACE);
01800 
01801         rc = lsi_prepare(lsi);
01802         if (rc)
01803                 RETURN(rc);
01804 
01805         /* Start low level OSD */
01806         rc = osd_start(lsi, sb->s_flags);
01807         if (rc) {
01808                 CERROR("Unable to start osd on %s: %d\n",
01809                        lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_dev, rc);
01810                 lustre_put_lsi(sb);
01811                 RETURN(rc);
01812         }
01813 
01814         CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "Found service %s on device %s\n",
01815                lsi->lsi_svname, lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_dev);
01816 
01817         if (class_name2obd(lsi->lsi_svname)) {
01818                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x161, "The target named %s is already "
01819                                    "running. Double-mount may have compromised"
01820                                    " the disk journal.\n",
01821                                    lsi->lsi_svname);
01822                 lustre_put_lsi(sb);
01823                 RETURN(-EALREADY);
01824         }
01825 
01826         /* Start MGS before MGC */
01827         if (IS_MGS(lsi) && !(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_flags & LMD_FLG_NOMGS)) {
01828                 rc = server_start_mgs(sb);
01829                 if (rc)
01830                         GOTO(out_mnt, rc);
01831         }
01832 
01833         /* Start MGC before servers */
01834         rc = lustre_start_mgc(sb);
01835         if (rc)
01836                 GOTO(out_mnt, rc);
01837 
01838         /* Set up all obd devices for service */
01839         if (!(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_flags & LMD_FLG_NOSVC) &&
01840             (IS_OST(lsi) || IS_MDT(lsi))) {
01841                 rc = server_start_targets(sb);
01842                 if (rc < 0) {
01843                         CERROR("Unable to start targets: %d\n", rc);
01844                         GOTO(out_mnt, rc);
01845                 }
01846                 /* FIXME overmount client here, or can we just start a
01847                  * client log and client_fill_super on this sb?  We
01848                  * need to make sure server_put_super gets called too
01849                  * - ll_put_super calls lustre_common_put_super; check
01850                  * there for LSI_SERVER flag, call s_p_s if so.
01851                  *
01852                  * Probably should start client from new thread so we
01853                  * can return.  Client will not finish until all
01854                  * servers are connected.  Note - MGS-only server does
01855                  * NOT get a client, since there is no lustre fs
01856                  * associated - the MGS is for all lustre fs's */
01857         }
01858 
01859         rc = server_fill_super_common(sb);
01860         if (rc)
01861                 GOTO(out_mnt, rc);
01862 
01863         RETURN(0);
01864 out_mnt:
01865         /* We jump here in case of failure while starting targets or MGS.
01866          * In this case we can't just put @mnt and have to do real cleanup
01867          * with stoping targets, etc. */
01868         server_put_super(sb);
01869         return rc;
01870 }
01871 
01872 /*
01873  * Calculate timeout value for a target.
01874  */
01875 void server_calc_timeout(struct lustre_sb_info *lsi, struct obd_device *obd)
01876 {
01877         struct lustre_mount_data *lmd;
01878         int soft = 0;
01879         int hard = 0;
01880         int factor = 0;
01881         bool has_ir = !!(lsi->lsi_flags & LDD_F_IR_CAPABLE);
01882         int min = OBD_RECOVERY_TIME_MIN;
01883 
01884         LASSERT(IS_SERVER(lsi));
01885 
01886         lmd = lsi->lsi_lmd;
01887         if (lmd) {
01888                 soft   = lmd->lmd_recovery_time_soft;
01889                 hard   = lmd->lmd_recovery_time_hard;
01890                 has_ir = has_ir && !(lmd->lmd_flags & LMD_FLG_NOIR);
01891                 obd->obd_no_ir = !has_ir;
01892         }
01893 
01894         if (soft == 0)
01895                 soft = OBD_RECOVERY_TIME_SOFT;
01896         if (hard == 0)
01897                 hard = OBD_RECOVERY_TIME_HARD;
01898 
01899         /* target may have ir_factor configured. */
01900         factor = OBD_IR_FACTOR_DEFAULT;
01901         if (obd->obd_recovery_ir_factor)
01902                 factor = obd->obd_recovery_ir_factor;
01903 
01904         if (has_ir) {
01905                 int new_soft = soft;
01906                 int new_hard = hard;
01907 
01908                 /* adjust timeout value by imperative recovery */
01909 
01910                 new_soft = (soft * factor) / OBD_IR_FACTOR_MAX;
01911                 new_hard = (hard * factor) / OBD_IR_FACTOR_MAX;
01912 
01913                 /* make sure the timeout is not too short */
01914                 new_soft = max(min, new_soft);
01915                 new_hard = max(new_soft, new_hard);
01916 
01917                 LCONSOLE_INFO("%s: Imperative Recovery enabled, recovery "
01918                               "window shrunk from %d-%d down to %d-%d\n",
01919                               obd->obd_name, soft, hard, new_soft, new_hard);
01920 
01921                 soft = new_soft;
01922                 hard = new_hard;
01923         }
01924 
01925         /* we're done */
01926         obd->obd_recovery_timeout   = max(obd->obd_recovery_timeout, soft);
01927         obd->obd_recovery_time_hard = hard;
01928         obd->obd_recovery_ir_factor = factor;
01929 }
